title: Unit 4 Assessment: Multimedia IR & Web Search

questions.text: The gap between raw multimedia data (pixels) and human perception (concepts) is called:
questions.explanation: Extracting high-level meaning from low-level features is the core challenge of multimedia modeling.

questions.text: Which index structure is commonly used for multi-dimensional spatial data in multimedia IR?
questions.explanation: R-Trees (Regional Trees) handle multi-dimensional bounding boxes efficiently.

questions.text: Automatic Feature Extraction in images might focus on:
questions.explanation: Colors and textures are key visual features extracted by multimedia systems.

questions.text: What is a major challenge unique to Web Search compared to traditional IR?
questions.explanation: Web content is adversarial, with spammers constantly trying to trick the ranking algorithms.

questions.text: A 'Meta Searcher' differs from a regular search engine because it:
options: Doesn't have its own index but queries other engines
questions.explanation: Meta searchers aggregate results from multiple independent engines.

questions.text: PageRank determines the importance of a web page based on:
options: The link structure of the web graph
The alphabetic rank of its URL
questions.explanation: PageRank uses the inbound links as votes of confidence from the network.

questions.text: The HITS algorithm identifies which two types of important pages?
questions.explanation: Hubs are pages that point to many good sources; Authorities are the high-quality sources themselves.
